sentences.en: an outspoken critic of the education reforms
sentences.cn: 对教育改革直言不讳的批评者

sentences.en: Dr Ramsay's outspoken bluffness made him easier to deal with.
sentences.cn: 而拉姆齐医生,由于他那种无保留的坦率性格,倒还容易对付.

sentences.en: Far from lying low, Kuti became more outspoken than ever.
sentences.cn: 库蒂不但没暂避风头，而且较以往更加直言不讳。

sentences.en: He became an outspoken opponent of the old Soviet system.
sentences.cn: 他成为旧的苏联体制直言不讳的抨击者。

sentences.en: He has made a string of outspoken and sometimes provocative speeches in recent years.
sentences.cn: 他近些年发表了一连串直言不讳、有时带煽动性的演说。

sentences.en: He is frank and outspoken and never beats about the bush.
sentences.cn: 他有意见就坦率地提出来,从不转弯抹角.

sentences.en: He was outspoken in his criticism.
How did he look, Sir? Was he portly, bold, outspoken, and hearty?
sentences.cn: 他看来怎样, 先生? 他是不是又魁梧 、 又豪放 、 又直爽 、 又精神饱满 呢 ?

sentences.en: I like him none the worse for being outspoken.
sentences.cn: 他说话虽然不客气但我仍然喜欢他.

sentences.en: It is possible to be outspoken without being rude.
sentences.cn: 既直言不讳又不显得粗鲁是可能做到的.

sentences.en: Meybe they were too candid or outspoken.
sentences.cn: 也许他们太耿直,或者说话不中听.

sentences.en: Such an outspoken article lays her open to criticism.
sentences.cn: 她这篇文章如此直言不讳,很容易招致批评.

sentences.en: The opprobrium and enmity he incurred were caused by his outspoken brashness.
sentences.cn: 他招致的轻蔑和敌意是由于他出言过于粗率而造成的.

sentences.en: The women in the group were style - conscious and outspoken.
sentences.cn: 这些女性注重时尚,坦率直言.

sentences.en: To be outspoken is easy when you do not wait to speak the complete truth.
sentences.cn: 如果你不等待着要说出完全的真理,那末把真话说出来是很容易的.

sentences.en: Uncle Frank is an outspoken man.
sentences.cn: 弗朗克叔叔是个坦率的人.

words.tran_cn: 坦率表示地；直言不讳地（outspoken的副词形式）

trans.tran_cn: 直言的，坦率的，毫无保留的，心急口快
trans.tran_en: expressing your opinions honestly and directly, even when doing this might annoy some people
